group_1.textLeft: So you're saying that Mihono's magic is what@sparked the whole incident?

group_1.textRight: What does Seira's magic do, exactly?

group_1.textLeft: Her "stage direction"? Well, she can create effects@that help heighten a dramatic scene...
Like changing the lighting to disguise what time of@day it is.

group_1.textRight: On the surface, yes.
But there's cases where a girl's magic activates@without her consciously realizing.
Because she gave acting directions to the@performers...
...telling them all to "truly inhabit their role"...
The cast members all behaved in a way that@faithfully replicated their characters.
I'm just so worried for Big Brother and everyone...

group_1.textLeft: As am I...

group_1.textCenter: The camera's stopped rolling, you two.

group_1.textRight: Huh? Camera?

group_1.textLeft: Oh...@right, we were filming?

group_1.narration: —Ruri—@So, where shall we be going today?@A cafe? ...Perhaps the theatre?

group_1.textLeft: ...I think you might be right.
It didn't feel like everyone was "just" giving a@passionate performance.

group_1.textRight: From my perspective as an observer, I too could@clearly see how strange it was.
Magic must have been involved.
And she did tell us that "inhabiting the role even@outside of filming" was important, too...

group_1.textLeft: But there's still some things that doesn't explain.
For one thing, Mihono wasn't just acting according@to the script.
She made comments that only Ruri herself could@have known about...
...You think there's other factors at work too, right,@Nemu?

group_1.textRight: Precisely.@I shall explain the second factor now.
Piece number two...
...is the effect of your magic, Mikura Komachi.

group_1.textLeft: Mine...?

group_1.textRight: Komachi's magic lets her discover buried historical@relics.
Tsukihiko's diary was one such discovery.

group_1.textLeft: ...I did become a Magical Girl to make a kofun@excavation happen, after all!

group_1.textRight: | We believe that "discovering" relics isn't all your@magic can do. |

group_1.textLeft: ...What's that supposed to mean?

group_1.textRight: | I received data with which to play the role of@childhood friend, and stored it in my database. |
| But as filming went on... |
| My database's records were gradually overwritten@with more detailed information. |

group_1.textLeft: Even though you were never given additional@material?

group_1.textRight: | Exactly.@The data began increasing on its own. |
After hearing about this, I formed a hypothesis.
This was most likely the result of a more@sophisticated magic...
Namely, the power to "restore" things that have@been lost.

group_1.narration: "I want... to make the excavation of that kofun a reality."
"I want to feel the breath of those people buried in history!"

group_1.textLeft: Komachi...

group_1.textRight: ...You might be right.
When I wished for the excavation to happen, the@burial chamber was 100% perfectly preserved.
There should've been at least a few artifacts that@were broken or stolen over the years, at minimum.
So were those artifacts actually "restored"...?

group_1.textLeft: If Komachi's magic has the same properties as@her wish...
Then when she found Tsukihiko's diary after filming@began...
It was because her magic "restored" it from a@damaged state?

group_1.textRight: ...Uh, that might not be great in terms of research@ethics? Like, as a historian, I'm getting mixed feelings.

group_1.textLeft: Well... I imagine it can't "forge" any historical@materials.
Since it's just "restoration," I wouldn't describe it as@bending the truth.

group_1.textRight: Yes, I estimate that her magic only restores genuine@articles.
What comes next is the real issue...
If we suppose that what happened in Sakurako's@database...
Was also occurring within each performer's own@brain...

group_1.textLeft: Then Tsukihiko, Ruri and everyone— their actual@personalities are being "restored" in the present@day...?

group_1.textRight: What...?!

group_1.textLeft: ...All the cast members were trying to perfectly@inhabit their character's role.
When they did so, they'd construct an "acting@persona" in their mind, unconsciously or otherwise.
And as our historical fact-checker, your magic@enhanced those personae into perfectly accurate@replicas...

group_1.textRight: Right. And with such precision that you could almost@say they'd been brought back to life.
So basically, they've got separate personalities in@their heads that emerge at certain times...?

group_1.textLeft: M-my magic did that...?!

group_1.textRight: Well, I'd hardly blame you for something that was unintentional.
